p: Moreover, the inhibitory activity of an essential oil is known to result from a complex interaction between its different constituents, which may produce additive, synergistic, or antagonistic effects, even for those present at low concentrations. Essential oils, which are odorous and volatile products of plant secondary metabolism, have wide applications in the food flavouring and preservation industries [ 33]. The results of this study suggest the possibility of using ClEO or some of its components as natural food preservatives, because they possess strong antibacterial activity.
